intro: Hetaeria tetraptera, commonly known as the four-winged hetaeria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Hetaeria tetraptera has a short growing season and relies on specific pollinators for reproduction. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
